hotel.name: Mill Hotel & Spa Destination Search
hotel.description: Discover Chester's favourite venue, The Mill Hotel & Spa Destination has a waterside location within the centre of the Roman City of Chester. The Mill offers Complementary Car Parking, use of the 60ft Swimming Pool, Jacuzzi, Steam Room and State of the art Techno-gym. The Public Bar has 16 different hand-pulled beers to choose from each week and has been featured in the Good Beer Guide for the last 10 years. The original Griffith's Corn Mill was built in c1830; the latest extention was completed in 2001 adding the south wing, which is connected with an internal bridge over the Shropshire Union Canal. The Mill has 5 different grades of rooms, from the Standard Rooms in the original Mill Building to the Spacious Club Class Rooms and very special Champagne Suite in the South Wing Building. All rooms are en-suite, have sky television and wifi. The Mill offers extensive dining options, with 5 options to wine & dine. The award wining waterside Canaletto Restaurant is open daily for lunch & dinner, serving food from both A la Carte and Table D'hote Menus. Friday & Saturdays in the Canaletto Restaurant are Dine & Dance evenings with dancing until 1.00am. L'eaut Cuisine Broad-beam Restaurant Cruiser moored alongside the hotel sails for lunch & dinner 7 days a week. Seating upto 50 people, the vessel has a licensed bar and dance floor. There are regular special events held, including Queen Mary Crown Cruises, Cruises and Roman High Tea Cruises. The Brasserie Flambe Steak Restaurant is open Sunday - Thursday, serving a range of starters, main courses and sweets plus a selection of special Mill Flamed Coffees. The Rialto Restaurant is located on the ground floor & is ideal for a light lunch after the gym, serving a range of sandwiches, baked potatoes, salads and a range of traditional home-made bar meals. In the tranquil surroundings of our Beauty Spa, we use only the finest Pevonia Botanica Products to provide face and body treatments for both men and women. Our retail counter stocks a comprehensive range of products, with free consultation and guidance. Further facilities include St. Tropez Ultimate Air Spray tanning booth, Hair Salon, Nail Bar and Kinesis Studio.
hotel.directions: Directions for the Mill Hotel, from the M53. Exit the M53 at Junction 12. Turn Right at the roundabout (A56). Carry straight on to the next roundabout.At the roundabout, go straight ahead (A56).Remain on the A56 (Hoole Road) for approximately 1 1/2 miles until you reach the next roundabout, take the first left exit (A5268). Take the 1st left into Seller Street. 2nd left into Milton Street . From Wrexham Carry on into Chester on the A483 Go over the Grovenor Bridge, over the River Dee , the Race Course is just visible on your left. At the next Roundabout take the left exit onto the A5268 Go over the 1st Roundabout (B&Q is on your left). Go over the 2nd Roundabout. The Mill is 50 meters on your left. Take the 1st Left into Seller Street and the 2nd Left into Milton Street.

hotel.name: ABode Chester Search
hotel.description: ABode's fifth opening and the first new build. The hotel features 85 Comfortable, Desirable, Enviable and Fabulous bedrooms all fitted to ABode's high standards and boasting magnificent views of Chester and the Welsh hills. At the centre of it all is a stunning fifth floor Abode Restaurant and Champagne bar. There is also an intimate Lounge Bar which are located on the ground floor and offer the opportunity for alfresco eating and drinking. ABode Chester also offers private dining and versatile meeting and event spaces for up to 100 guests. There is also a residents gym equipped with state of the art Technogym equipment. Situated alongside Chester's historic racecourse and five minutes walk from the city centre ABode Chester is the perfect place to stay whatever your reason for visiting. Group bookings constitute over 6 bedrooms and the hotel may contact you to issue a separate cancellation policy. Within a few minutes walk to the city centre, the hotel is in easy access to Chester Zoo and Cheshire Oaks Designer Outlet. Abode Chester is located 1.5 miles from Chester Railway Station.
hotel.directions: * Leave the M56 at junction 15, then join the M53 motorway (signposted Chester) * Leave the M53 at junction 12, then at roundabout take the 3rd exit onto the A56 (signposted Chester) * At roundabout take the 2nd exit onto the A56 (signposted Chester City Centre) * At Hoole Way roundabout take the 3rd exit onto the A5268 (signposted Ellesmere Port, Hoylake) * At Fountains roundabout take the 2nd exit onto the A5268 (signposted Queensferry, Wrexham) * Turn right onto Black Friars * Turn left onto Nun's Road * Turn left onto the A483 * Finish on Grosvenor Road •	Chester Railway Station •	Station Rd, 1st Floor West Wing Offices, Chester CH1 3NT, UK •	Take Station Rd and Brook St to Hoole Way/A56 •	Take A5268 to Watergate St/A548 •	Take Nuns Rd to Grosvenor Rd/A483 •	Turn left onto Grosvenor Rd/A483 •	Destination will be on the left

facility: Tea/Coffee making facilities in each room
Iron And Board In Each Room
Limited room service for hot food

hotel.name: George and Dragon
hotel.description: "The George and Dragon is an old Coaching Inn only 5 minutes’ walk from Chester City Centre, perfect for anyone planning a trip to check out the City's sights. This is a traditional house suiting those looking to have a good nights sleep and hot pub grub. On Wednesday nights the local Chester University students join us, on Thursdays we have karaoke, Friday a live DJ and on Sunday we have our famous quiz night! Music and entertainment last until midnight, with the bar taking final orders at 1am on Fridays and Saturdays. The pub is located in a vibrant area of the city, in close proximity to the University of Chester and within walking distance of the racecourse. We are situated opposite the current bus station. The George and Dragon boasts 14 letting bedrooms, all including free wi-fi, tea and coffee making facilities, with a television and digi-box. Every room has its own en-suite bathroom with shower or bath. Car-parking is also available and a pay & display ticket needs to be purchased. This is refundable upon check-in at reception! This means FREE parking for our hotel guests! Our car parking is 24 hour, which allows you to explore Chester the next day after check-out. The George and Dragon is famous for sports viewing, cask ales, traditional pub food and entertainment. We hope to see you soon!"
hotel.directions: We are 10 minutes drive from the M53 juction 12 Take the A56 to Chester, at the first round about take the second exit carry on driving for 5 minutes until you reach another roundabout take the 3rd exit head to the fountains roundabout and take the 3rd exit again and you will see us directly in front of you!!

facility: Tea/Coffee making facilities in each room

hotel.name: Village Hotel Chester St Davids
hotel.address: St. Davids Park, Ewloe Chester CH5 3YB
hotel.description: Village Hotel St David's Chester offers plenty to do during your stay with the cities of Chester and Liverpool or the mountains of Snowdonia never far away. With easy access to an array of nearby attractions including Chester Zoo, Blue Planet Aquarium and shopping at Cheshire Oaks. Feeling lucky? Have a flutter at Chester or Bangor-on-Dee, both hosting very popular events. Village Hotel Club offers you everything under one roof: cool room big bed; a pool you can swim in; a gym and spa you can relax in; stylish dining or traditional pub grub; Starbucks and FREE Car Parking. All rooms are uber chic and include FREE Wi-Fi which is also available in all public areas. Why not upgrade to a Club Room - the must-have room with genuinely good extras! Village Gym Entrance Fee: £5.00 per adult per stay (children free of charge) including access to Health & Fitness Club, pool, sauna and steam room. Check-in and check-out is done at the self-service kiosks. Enjoy the wonderful amenities and great service at the Village Hotel Chester St David’s.
hotel.directions: Car: M6 , M56 for North Wales till end of M56. Keep Left and travel 3 miles on the A494 towards North Wales. Approaching top of steep hill take B5127 Buckley Slip road and the Hotel is directly infront of you. Rail: Hawarden Station - 2 miles. Shotton Station - 4 miles. Chester Station - 10 miles. Air: Liverpool John Lennon Airport - 18 miles. Manchester International - 45 miles.

facility: Tea/Coffee making facilities in each room

hotel.name: Dene Hotel Chester
hotel.description: The Dene Hotel Chester, is an established family run hotel in an attractive setting less than one mile from the City centre. Developed and extended over several decades, the Dene Hotel has become a landmark in the suburbs of this historic city. Our friendly yet professional team prides itself on offering high service standards, while our prices reflect our ethos of giving good value for money. All 53 rooms have en-suite facilities,and we have the ability to alter their set up to accommodate up to four adults, or a family with children. Located within a mile of both the M53 and A55, the Dene Hotel is ideally situated as both a gateway to North Wales and the rural county of Cheshire. The Dene bar offers a wide variety of bottled beers and ales along with traditional bar meals. Full English breakfasts are very competitively priced and cooked to order to make them an exceptional treat while you stay with us. The Dene Hotel has ample free car parking, allowing you to wander into the city through the village of Hoole with its many artisan boutiques and local amentities. The city centre and the railway station are less than one mile away and the hotel is located on several of Chester's frequent bus services. Chester is one of the best-preserved walled cities in England with medieval galleried streets and an extensive range of quality shops, ideal for summer strolls and Christmas bargains. The historic city of Chester is the perfect location for exploring the North West and Wales, and is home to one of Britain's finest racecourses. Snowdonia National Park is less than an hour's drive away and also within easy reach are the Peak District, the Lake District, the Fylde coast and the cities of Manchester and Liverpool. In the immediate vicinity, one can find thousands on places to visit including; Jodrell Bank, Tatton Park, Chirk and Conway Castles, Snowdon Mountain Railway, Mouldsworth Motor Museum and Erddig Hall.
hotel.directions: The Dene Hotel is situated within easy reach of the enchanting city of Chester. Awash with history and heritage and bustling with vibrant city life. 1 mile from Chester City centre and junction 12 off the M53. The first hotel you come to driving into Chester on Hoole Road. This hotel is ideal for business or leisure traveller. By road: From the M53, take junction 12 and follow the A56 towards Chester. The Dene is located half a mile along this road, and just one mile from the city centre. By air: Chester is only 40 minutes from Manchester airport and 30 minutes from Liverpool's John Lennon Airport By rail: Chester railway station is just half a mile away from the hotel. Parking: Ample free parking is available in the hotel grounds.

facility: Tea/Coffee making facilities in each room
Wheelchair Access To Disabled Car Parking Spaces

hotel.name: Bridge Street Townhouse
hotel.address: 49-51, Lower Bridge Street Chester Chester CH1 1RS
hotel.description: Formerly known as The D Hotel, a beautiful Georgian house built in 1699 by lawyer, John Mather. The hotel comprises of 3 floors with 18 rooms with a cellar and a further 11 rooms in the annex to the rear of the house. Ideally located within the city walls in the heart of historic Chester and 100 meters from the the River Dee it is a perfect location for sites and shops of this beautiful city, and is an ideal base to discover the surrounding beauty of North Wales and Liverpool. Manchester and Liverpool airports are only 45 minutes away. The hotel offers en-suite rooms and free Wi-Fi throughout. The rooms feature a flat-screen TV, tea/coffee making facilities with Free toiletries, linen and towels are also included. Please note that the rooms are situated across a number of floors, with no lift access. With a bar on the ground floor, there are also plenty of restaurants, pubs and bus stops which services the city tour less than 50 meters away. A continental breakfast is available every morning between 8am and 10am charged at £6.95 a head, please prebook with reception on arrival Nearby attractions include Chester Cathedral, Roman Amphitheatre, Chester Castle and Grosvenor Park, the main ornamental park in Chester, all found just a stroll from the hotel. There are golf courses less than 1.5 miles away. Chester Zoo and Cheshire Oaks Designer Outlet are only 8 and 13 minutes drive away with Liverpool City Centre only a 35 minutes drive. The Hotel would suggest parking at the NCP car park on Pepper Street.
hotel.directions: From the Chester train station main car park, turn left to the next roundabout. Take the second left off the roundabout follow the road round past the first and second set of traffic lights. Turn left at the 3rd set of traffic lights you will find (Tesco Express) on your left. You will find us 100 meters on your left just pass the bus stop.

facility: Tea/Coffee making facilities in each room

hotel.name: Macdonald New Blossoms Hotel
hotel.description: Located in the heart of the vibrant historic city of Chester, the Macdonald Blossoms Hotel retains most of it's original victorian features, with a mix of period charm and modern luxury. Ideally located, the hotel is just a short stroll away from the famous shopping 'Rows' , scenic riverside, Cathedral and Roman City Walls. Our stylish new 1650 St Johns Restaurant serves a delicious selection fresh fish and meats cooked to perfection, there's no better place to enjoy a delicious meal. Booking in advance is recommended to guarantee availability. Other attractions nearby include Chester racecourse, just a gentle 10 minute stroll through the vibrant streets of the city. Chester Zoo can also be reached by car or local bus for those wishing to venture outside the Centre. Chester is famous for it's shopping experience and the famous Cheshire Oaks Outlet Village is also a short drive from the hotel. The hotel is also within easy reach of Chester Business Park, home to Bank of America, HBOS, M&S Money to name a few. Also the Industrial Parks of both Ellesmere Port and Deeside are easy to reach too. Due to the hotel's central location, the nearest car park is the Grosvenor Shopping Centre Car Park - Post Code: CH1 1CA. The car park is open 24 hours a day and at the cost of £10.00 per 24 hours.
hotel.directions: Please visit our website www.macdonaldhotels.co.uk/newblossoms or call the hotel prior to arrival for a directional map to be sent via email. We regret that we do not send maps through the postal service in the interest of energy and environmental conservation. Car Parking is at the Grosvenor Shopping Centre Car Park located on the next road to the hotel. Please email or telephone the hotel for further instructions, you will then be sent detailed directions of how to access the car park or to the hotel entrance. Car parking is charged at £10 per 24 hours

facility: Tea/Coffee making facilities in each room

Limited room service for hot food

hotel.name: Grosvenor Pulford Hotel and Spa
hotel.description: Winner of Visit Chester & Cheshire's Large Hotel of the Year 2007. The privately owned Grosvenor Pulford Hotel & Spa is ideally located just a 5 minute drive from Chester's historic city centre, yet a stone's throw from the city centre of Wrexham and Wales. This beautiful hotel, set in its own grounds, has 73 superb comfortable bedrooms, all with en-suite facilities. The hotel has free parking for all guests and complimentary WiFi. Within the hotel there are two dining venues from which you can choose. Ciro's Brasserie is a Rosette rated Mediterranean themed restaurant offering modern European cuisine. On a Sunday we serve a traditional roast carvery luncheon and dinner. Alternatively, you may prefer to relax in Nelson's Bar where you will find a good selection of gastro style bar food and fine traditional ales. Take time during your stay to step through the doors of Spa by Kasia where we provide natural, holistic and organic treatments to completely nourish, rebalance and repair the face and body. This exclusive retreat includes 6 indulgent treatment suites including a VIP couple's suite with hydrotherapy bath, 3 relaxation rooms, a traditional Turkish Hamman, an Arabian Rasul, Rejuvenation Skin Clinic, Roman style swimming pool, Jacuzzi, steam room, sauna, state of the art Technogym gymnasium, outdoor tennis court, Spa Boutique and Spa Eatery. Residents are strongly advised to book their treatments in advance. The hotel offers ample free parking and complimentary internet access throughout.
hotel.directions: From the M6:Exit from M6 at junction 20 onto M56 westbound (Runcorn, Warrington, North Wales).Exit from M56 at junction 15 onto M53 southbound towards Chester.Continue to the end of M53 which merges with the A55.Exit from A55 signposted for A483 Chester to Wrexham.Turn left at roundabout, then left again at next roundabout signposted B5445 Pulford, (Eccelston).The Grosvenor Pulford Hotel is approx 2 miles on the right. The Grosvenor Pulford Hotel & Spa is easily accessible from the motorway network A55, M53, M56 and M6, and the international airports of Manchester and Liverpool

hotel.name: Base Serviced Apartments - City Road
hotel.description:
Situated in the historic city of Chester, City Road is ideal for long and short stays, as well as family, business or leisure breaks. We offer a choice of one or two bedroom apartments, fully equipped and fully furnished ready for when you are. Our apartments are only a short distance from some of the cities’ places of interest including: the Forum Shopping Centre, Chester Cathedral and Chester Racecourse. Chaser Railway Station is also within walking distance from the accommodation and can be reached with ease.

Check-in time is between 3pm and 6pm at the apartment’s location. Complimentary self-check-in service is available for all guests arriving after 6 PM. The instructions will be provided after reservation is confirmed. All keys must be collected from and returned upon departure to the property address: 19 - 21 City Road, Chester, CH1 3AE.

Base Serviced Apartments aim to meet and exceed our customers’ expectations, firstly, by ensuring all of our guests respect other residents and their surroundings. We therefore operate an age restriction of guests no younger than 25 years. On arrival, photographic identification will be requested, alongside a security deposit in the form of a card pre-authorisation (from £50 up to £250 per person). Bookings will be cancelled if this is not presented and no refund will be issued.

Please note that Laser, Maestro, Solo cards or cash for pre-authorisation will not be accepted. Regretfully, any potential reservations for stag or hen parties will not be honoured at any of our locations and will be subjected to a cancellation (no refund will be issued). There is an additional transaction fee of 1.9% for using credit cards. The card holder must be present at the time of check-in.
hotel.directions: Head southwest on M56 toward Exit 5. At junction 15, exit onto M53 towards Chester/Wrexham and carry on driving for aproximately 3 minutes. Then, at junction 12, take the A56 exit to Chester and drive for 0.2 miles until you reach a roundabout. At the roundabout take the 1st exit onto ST. Oswalds Way / A5268 and continue to follow for another 0.3 miles until A5268 turns into City Road. Your destination will be on the right hand side, next to 'The Cellar' pub (It's the green door to the right).

rate.roomTerms: A 10% deposit will be taken upon booking, using the card provided. The deposit is fully refundable if a booking is cancelled more than seven days before date of arrival. The remaining balance of 90% will be taken 7 days prior to arrival and booking will then become fully non-refundable and non-amendable. Apartments cannot be reserved if the required payment has not been received.Please note, we have an 'over 25' age policy in place and we do not accept Stag or Hen Parties.

hotel.name: Chester Court Hotel
hotel.description: Conveniently located within walking distance of the city centre and railway station, and within 3/4 of a mile from the major motorway network.Our 20 en-suite bedrooms are comfortably furnished and provide all the features you would expect from a modern hotel.Relax in this friendly, family run hotel where you will find the emphasis on comfort and cleanliness, where our staff will treat you as an individual and take time to meet your needs. Free parking in our large car park. Full English breakfast and continental options included in the room rate. Please note that our guest bedrooms are non-smoking.
hotel.directions: Leave M56 at junction 15 (M53)Leave M53 at junction 12 (A56)Follow A56 (Hoole Road) towards city centreHotel is approx 1 mile from the motorway exit, situated opposite 'All Saints' church. We are on the right hand side.

facility: Tea/Coffee making facilities in each room

hotel.name: Travelodge Cheshire Oaks
hotel.address: Coliseum Leisure Park, Coliseum Way Ellesmere Port Cheshire CH65 9HD
hotel.description: Our Cheshire Oaks hotel is on the outskirts of historic Chester, a short drive from the vibrant centre. It also offers easy access to the neighbouring retail heaven of Cheshire Oaks Designer Outlet. For families, the hotel is a great base for visits to the fantastic Chester Zoo or the underwater world of Blue Planet Aquarium, which is only a mile away. All rooms feature a comfy king size bed with four plump pillows and a cosy duvet. Guests can enjoy a wide variety of food and drink choices within easy walking distance from this hotel. Early/Late Check-In/Out Service – if you’re looking to make the most of your day we can offer an Early Check-In service from 12:00noon and a Late Check-Out Service until 2pm so you have more time to relax - cost is £10 per service, per room, subject to availability - bookable direct by telephoning the hotel. For guests wishing to bring domestic pets please visit our website www.travelodge.co.uk for more detail on charges and terms and conditions. Please note that Guide dogs, Hearing dogs, and other animals to aid disability are exempt from charge.
hotel.directions: From junction 10 M53 take exit to A5117 towards Cheshire Oaks. Take the second exit at the next roundabout onto Kinsey Road. Continue along Kinsey Road onto Coliseum Way. The Travelodge is situated on Coliseum Way, which has a one way system in place. Please follow signs for Cinema and exit to reach ample parking at the rear of the hotel. Parking details Travelodge has free of charge car parking, available on a first come, first served basis. Please follow signs for Cinema and exit to reach ample parking at the rear of the hotel.

facility: Tea/Coffee making facilities in each room

hotel.name: Quarterz
hotel.description: Quarterz of Chester is Located in the heart of Chester. Quarterz is a new city center hotel that boasts 36 en suite bedrooms. Free view Tv is availble in all rooms. Hypo allergenic beds throughout with Free Wi Fi connection throughout the whole hotel Chester train station is located just 3 minutes walk from the hotel, and we are located just a 2 - 3 minute walk from the city centre. A security deposit is pre-authorized on your card on arrival. This deposit is fully refundable upon check-out and subject to a damage inspection of the accommodation. Please note, Loss of keys/TV remote or any damage or disruption during your stay will result in the loss of your full security deposit. Quarterz apart hotel will hold your card details for a period of 7 days, should the damage costs exceed your security deposit this will be charged to the card details on file.
hotel.directions: From the train station City Road is directly in front of the exit and Quarterz is located around 600 yards up on the right hand side Located in the City Centre Quaterz can be acsessed from City Road coming in from the main Hoole road

facility: Tea/Coffee making facilities in each room

hotel.name: Macdonald Craxton Wood Hotel & Spa
hotel.description: Macdonald Craxton Wood Hotel & Spa is set within 27 acres of woodland and gardens, yet only 6 miles from Chester city centre. The hotel is a perfect location for guests staying for leisure or business. It is literally just minutes away from Deeside Industrial Estate, Ellesmere Port and Chester Business park, as well as the M56, M53 and 20 minutes drive from the M6. Equally, the hotel's tranquil setting and proximity to Chester, the beautiful Wirrall countryside, North Wales and the Cheshire Oaks shopping outlet makes this ideal base for those wishing to explore the area. The major cities of Chester, Liverpool "The Capital of Culture 2008" and Manchester are only short drives away. From here you can visit any of the major attractions, sporting and musical events taking place in the region. Our leisure club provides opportunities that are second to none, with the latest equipment and a team of fitness and beauty professionals. Try a few lengths in our 18m pool or unwind and re-engergize in the aromatic steam room or sauna. For food lovers we have The British Grill, our newly refurbished 2 AA rosette restaurant offering classic British dishes, with a twist. Free wifi is available in all public areas, meetings rooms and guest rooms.
hotel.directions: By Road: Leave the M6 at junction 20. Take the M56 for Chester and North Wales to the end, then take the A5117 to Queensferry. Turn right at the first crossroads onto the A540 to Hoylake. The hotel should be 200 yards past the traffic lights on the left By Rail: Chester Station is approximately 15 minutes by car/taxi By Air: Manchester Airport is approximately 35 minutes by car/taxi.

hotel.name: Shenley Lodge
hotel.description: All en-suite rooms. Fully Non Smoking Guest House. 10 minutes from City centre. Double and Family room. Free view T.V. & DVD, Hairdryer on request. Wireless internet access for enabled laptops.
hotel.directions: M53 junction 12, follow signs to City centre. Along A56 turn right into Newton Lane. Shenley Lodge is located on righthand sideJust 10 minutes from railway station

facility: Tea/Coffee making facilities in each room

hotel.name: Swan at Tarporley
hotel.address: 50 High Street Tarporley nr Chester CW6 0AG
hotel.description: Located in the village of Tarporley just 15 minutes to Chester, dating back to the 16th Century Swan at Tarporley has been sympathetically restored and updated to include free Wi-Fi, car parking and widely recognised restaurant. From morning coffee's to classical afternoon teas, a snack lunch or evening dinner, the hotel offers a wide range of fresh, locally sourced ingredients with menus changed daily. Each en-suite bedroom is unique using rich colours. Rooms have fresh white linen and comfy warm throws with individual touches such as Gilchrist and Soames toiletries, colour television, direct dial telephone, trouser press, tea and coffee making facilities and more, which is all you’d expect from a true country hotel. Nothing has been forgotten with a selection of singles, doubles, twins, families and suites, six of which are located in the converted Coaching Inn. The hotel believes in presenting uncomplicated food served in a friendly environment. There are always at least 4 cask beers available at any one time, in addition to the normal favourites there are also a selection of seasonal ales. There is an extensive wine list which has been carefully selected from classic French to New World including 12 whites, 12 reds and a good selection of rose and sparkling wines. Overlooking Tarporley High Street, the spectacularly historic Georgian Hunt Room which lends itself to any occasion with a sense of history. This can accommodate your needs with exclusive use of the function room and private bar which offers much more flexibility for arrangements and timings. The hotel pride themselves on the personal service given to guests whilst organising the day, and thanks to the wealth of experience staff know how to create a flawless day within a unique and perfect setting. Tarporley Village has an array of boutique fashion shops, delis, country pursuits shops, chocolate emporiums and much more. This is also a mid point on the Sandstone Trail with 34 miles of beautiful walking, cycling or horse riding over the Cheshire Plains and into Shropshire. Other areas of interest include many golf courses, Delamere Forest, Go Ape, Cheshire Polo Club, Cotebrook Shire Horse Centre, Beeston Castle, Oulton Park, Blakemore Craft Centre, Supagolf, Falconery Centre, Chester City, Chester Zoo, Blue Planet Aquarium, Anderton Boat Lift, Cholmondeley Castle, Cheshire Oaks, Arley Hall, Tatton Park, Capesthore Hall, Combermere Abbey and Eaton Hall. The local C84 bus allows easy access to Chester of Crewe. Churchills the cleaners are located almost adjacent to the Swan. Turn right from the front door and they are 100 yards down the street. Newspapers and General Store - There is a newsagent and general store situated approximately 200 yards from the Swan.
hotel.directions: The Swan is located in the centre of Tarporley. From the south on the M6 Exit junction 15 heading onto the A500 to Nantwich. After 7 miles head onto A51 by passing Nantwich. After a further 10 miles go straight across a set of lights (Red Fox on corner). After 500 yards turn right into the village. The Swan is half way up the High Street on your left. From the M56 Exit at junction 10 following the A49 south for about 14 miles. After a long descent you will reach a roundabout. Turn left into the village. The Swan is approximately 500 yards on your right hand side. From Liverpool and Chester. Follow the A51 south until you reach a roundabout 9 miles from the A55. Go straight into the village. The Swan is approximately 500 yards on your right hand side.

facility: Tea/Coffee making facilities in each room
Wheelchair Access To Disabled Car Parking Spaces

hotel.name: Trafford Hall
hotel.address: Ince Lane, Wimbolds Trafford Chester CH2 4JP
hotel.description: Originally built in 1756, Trafford Hall offers a collection of eco-chalets set amongst 14 acres of woodland. The chalets are less than 14 minutes’ drive from the city of Chester. Inside, each of the cosy rooms at Trafford Hall features a bathroom with a shower, complimentary toiletries, fresh towels, linen and a view of the vibrant gardens. Close to a number of golf courses, the nearest is Sandfield Golf Driving Range and Golf Course, just an 8-minute walk from the chalets. For food, shopping and entertainment, The Grosvenor Shopping Centre is a 13-minute journey by car. From the hall, Chester Racecourse is less than 6 miles away. Chester Zoo is just an 11-minute journey in the car and Gulliver’s World Resort is 19 miles away. The city of Liverpool is also 31 minutes’ drive away.
hotel.directions: By Car From the North take the M6 heading South to J20/9 for the M56 – signposted Chester / North Wales. Take Junction 14 on the M56 signposted Stanlow / Elton. Take the first exit off the roundabout to Helsby. After 0.5 mile turn right onto the A56. Turn right onto the B5132, Trafford Hall is on the right next to the driving range. From the South Take the M6 North. Exit at J9/20 for the M56. Then follow directions as above. From the East Take the A51 to Chester, which joins the A55. Turn right onto the A55 (signposted to the M56) Exit at J12. Turn right at the roundabout onto the A56 towards Frodsham and Helsby. Continue through Mickle Trafford. Turn left onto the B5132. Trafford Hall is located on the right. By Train Chester is the nearest train station. We recommend you check train times and details on www.thetrainline.com Approximate journey times are: Manchester to Chester: 1hour Liverpool to Chester: 40 minutes Crewe to Chester: 20 minutes London to Chester: 2 hours Taxis are available outside Chester station, and the journey takes approximately 10 minutes.

facility: Tea/Coffee making facilities in each room
Wheelchair Access To Disabled Car Parking Spaces

hotel.name: Holt Lodge Hotel
hotel.address: Wrexham Road, Nr Holt, Wrexham Wrexham LL13 9SW
hotel.description: In its own grounds, just 5 minutes from Wrexham and only 15 minutes from the heart of Chester's city centre, this privately owned hotel offers free Wi-Fi and free on-site parking. The Holt Lodge has a good location, with easy access by road to both Wrexham and Chester. The coast of North Wales is also within easy reach. There are 36 comfortable rooms, all with en suite baths and showers. All rooms have a telephone, a digital TV, a trouser press, ironing facilities, a hair dryer and tea/coffee making facilities. In the evening, the beautifully appointed bistro offers an extensive à la carte menu and boasts a great reputation for excellent cuisine. For a quieter, more casual atmosphere, you can relax in the comfortable bar area. Tea, coffee and drinks are available all day. The Holt Lodge has its own car park at the rear of the hotel
hotel.directions:

At r'bout, take 3rd exit on Speke Hall Ave. Turn right Speke Church Rd.

Slight left at Blackrod Ave, turn right at Wood End Ln.

Merge onto M56, At junction 15, exit onto M53. Liverpool Airport cont.. - Road: Continue on A55 (signs for Whitchurch/Wrexham).

Take the A483 exit toward Chester/Wrexham.

At the roundabout, take the 1st exit onto A483/Wrexham Rd.

Continue to follow A483, go through 1 roundabout, entering Wales.

At junction 6, exit toward Wrecsam/A534/Nantwich.

At the roundabout, take the 2nd exit onto A5156. Go through 1 roundabout.

At the roundabout, take the 1st exit onto A534. 

Destination will be on the left Chester - Road: Head west on Princess St toward A5268/St Martins Way.

Turn left at A5268/St Martins Way, continue to follow A5268.

At the roundabout, take the 3rd exit onto A483/Grosvenor Rd. Continue to follow A483.

Go through 5 roundabouts, entering Wales.

At junction 6, exit toward Wrecsam/A534/Nantwich.

At the roundabout, take the 2nd exit onto A5156. Go through 1 roundabout.

At the roundabout, take the 1st exit onto A534, 

Destination will be on the left. Wrexham Central Railway Station - Road: Head northeast on St Mark's Rd toward Regent St.

Turn left at Regent St.

hotel.name: Peckforton Castle
hotel.address: Stone House Lane Peckforton Tarporley CW6 9TN
hotel.description: Rising majestically above the Cheshire landscape, the castle is both enigmatic and enchanting. Originally the home of Lord Tollemache and built in the early 19th Century, this Grade I listed building is the only intact medieval style Castle in the country. Over the years the castle has been the location for numerous movies including Robin Hood and Dr Who. Now owned by the Naylor family, the stunning exterior has been complemented by a loving and considered restoration programme resulting in a magnificent hotel and venue offering contemporary luxury and impeccable service. Services include 48 stunning individual guest rooms, conference, events, and wedding facilities for up to 180. Tranquility beauty, on site Falconry and team activities all adding up to a rather magical experience. This captivating castle offers 48 stunning bedrooms, all individually designed and beautifully appointed, blending luxury and contemporary décor befit to any King or Queen, Prince or Princess. From executive rooms, spacious with relaxation areas, fairy-tale four poster rooms, suites for a romantic break to family rooms that comfortably accommodate parents with the little ones, all the guestrooms boast original features designed with complete luxury in mind. The individual styling perfectly complements the original features creating a real sense of history and modern majestic flair. They ooze opulence and are so inviting and comfortable. The historical original features blend seamlessly with the modern comforts of today's living with all rooms offering full en-suite bathroom facilities, flat screen televisions, complimentary high speed Wi-Fi, hospitality trays, plus the usual direct dial telephones, hairdryers, irons and ironing boards and 24 –hour in room dining.
hotel.directions: From M56 come off at Junction 10 folowing signs to Whitchurch A49, follow this road for approx 25 minutes, you will eventually come to traffic lights with the Red Fox Pub on your right hand side. Turn right sign posted to Beeston Castle, you will then spot signs for Peckforton Castle. From the M6 Junction 16, follow signs to Nantwich and then to Chester on the A51. At traffic lights turn left following signs to Beeston Castle and then you will spot signs for Peckforton Castle.

rate.roomTerms: A £30 deposit per night will be required at the time of booking which is non-refundable and non-transferable. No further charge will be made until departure. If a booking is cancelled after 12 noon day prior to arrival, 100% charge will be made for the first night's stay.

hotel.name: Willington Hall Hotel
hotel.description: Situated at the foot of the Willington Hills this exquisite 3 star AA rated hotel offers free Wi-Fi and parking with wonderful views across the Cheshire countryside. Within easy reach of airport, railway and the motorway network, this historic hotel is the perfect base for touring Chester and Cheshire. Willington Hall was built in 1829 once a private house of the Tomkinson family and was converted into this wonderful hotel in 1977. The architect, George Latham, practised a style he called ‘Queen Elizabethan’ and the period features and country house charm have been preserved to this day. In 1999 the Begbie family, hotel proprietors for three generations, took over the hotel and have lovingly restored the house and gardens. Each of the 12 en-suite bedrooms are individually designed with their own unique layout and antique furnishings. All of these luxurious rooms contain Egyptian cotton linen and complimentary toiletries, equipped with all necessary amenities to ensure a comfortable stay. In addition, all of the bedrooms have digital TV, radio, hairdryer, trouser press, tea and coffee making facilities. Most of these elegant rooms boast a magnificent view across the extensive parkland, the types of which range from Single, Double, Twin and Four Poster. There are 17 acres of formal gardens and parkland surrounding the hotel, which provide wonderful views across the Cheshire countryside. Guests are welcome to explore these grounds and enjoy the rolling lawns, York stone terraces, follies and kitchen gardens. The Gainsborough Restaurant provides full a la carte and table d’hôtel menus for both residents and non-residents daily. The head chef prepares a fusion of modern British cuisine with fresh local produce wherever possible, much of which is grown in the commercial greenhouse within the grounds. These delightful dishes are complimented by the varied selection of wine from the extensive wine list. The study and drawing room offers a bar menu and is open throughout the day to provide drinks and light snacks a perfect place to meet friends and family alike, or maybe Afternoon Tea can be enjoyed on the Terrace, weather-permitting. Willington Hall is an ideal venue for conference and business meetings, of which can be held in the main house or in the dedicated conferencing facilities which can cater for up to 200 delegates. The grounds are also at the disposal for team building exercises and the conference manager is on hand to assist in organising activities such as clay shooting, archery, falconry. For a more relaxing day why not try one of the beauty treatments available that will make you feel totally relaxed and beautifully groomed. Whatever the occasion Weddings, Christenings, Cocktail parties or intimate dinner Willington Hall with its period features and country house charm provides a superb setting for the most memorable occasion, and even boasts a helicopter landing facility for those who want to arrive in style. Situated 9 miles from Chester City Centre and close to major transport routes, Willington Hall is easily accessible. The hotel can be reached from the A556/A54 from Northwich/Winsford, or the A54 from Chester or the A49 from Tarporley/Nantwich. The nearest train station is Delamere, which is approximately 6 miles away, the next closest being Chester and Crewe. Taxis can be arranged for pick up from Delamere as well as the other mainline stations.
hotel.directions: The hotel can be reached from the A556/A54 from Northwich/Winsford, or the A54 from Chester or the A49 from Tarporley/Nantwich. The nearest train station is Delamere, which is approximately 6 miles away, the next closest being Chester and Crewe. Helicopter landing facilities: Lat N5311.30 Long. W00242.10 Nat. hotel.name: Green Gables Guest House
hotel.address: 11, Eversley Park Off Liverpool Road Chester CH2 2AJ
hotel.description: Green Gables is an attractive Victorian house, situated in a quiet residential area, yet just 15 minutes walk from the many sights and shopping facilities of Chester. Set within its own pretty garden, the house offers first-class accommodation, with the decor and service you would expect from a high-class hotel. Arrive as a guest, leave as a friend. Our house is set in a pleasant and private garden with secure parking facilities within the grounds for guests arriving by car. Undercover storage for bicycles is also provided. We have a delightful, dining room where we serve breakfast between 7 and 9 am, whilst our elegant sitting room is the perfect place to sit and relax at the end of the day. A choice of English and Continental breakfast is served in the breakfast room. A typical menu also includes fruit juice, a variety of cereals, toast, a choice of jams, honey and marmalade, tea and coffee. Special dietary requirements can be catered for if requested in advance. Our bedrooms are comfortable and tastefully decorated, with en-suite facilities, tea and coffee-making equipment, Freeview TV, trouser press and Wireless Internet Connection for customers with their own laptop. Guests have access to the house at any time of the day and we maintain a strict no-smoking policy. No dogs are allowed except guide dogs. As can be expected from an establishment with a 4 star grading by the AA, our standards of cleanliness are very high, and we pride ourselves on maintaining the very highest levels of service. So much so that many of our guests return year after year, whilst our landlady Mrs. Dorota Perruzza, was a top 20 finalist in Landlady of the year 1995!
hotel.directions: Green Gables is just 15 minutes walk from Chester city centre. If travelling by car, follow the sign for Countess of Chester Hospital (A5116 Liverpool Road). Turn right at the third pedestrian set of traffic lights into Eversley Park. We are the last house on the left. Our Address and Contact Details: Mrs. Dorota Perruzza Green Gables 11 Eversley Park CHESTER CH2 2AJ (Sat navigation: post code = CH2 2AJ)
